jobTitle: Concert & Artist Administrative Assistant - Remote | WFH
description:
Job Description: Western Region Administrative Assistant

Position Summary

We are seeking a dedicated and organized Western Region Administrative Assistant to join our dynamic team based in Los Angeles. Reporting directly to the Senior Manager, you will play a crucial role in the day-to-day operations of our Concert & Artist (C&A) markets across major cities such as LA, San Diego, San Francisco, Portland, Seattle, Scottsdale, Miami, Denver, and Chicago, with potential for expansion to additional American cities.

Main Responsibilities

  • **Event Coordination and Logistics:**
  • Coordinate and confirm event logistics with production staff.
  • Confirm bookings with movers and tuners for new and recurring C&A orders, under the guidance of the Senior Manager.
  • **Financial Management:**
  • Process customer payments, including receiving and depositing checks, credit card payments, and wire transactions.
  • Post approved rental sales invoices in the company's ERP system.
  • Follow up on delinquent customer accounts to maintain a clean accounts receivable report.
  • **Vendor Management:**
  • Organize and submit approved vendor invoices to the accounting department.
  • Communicate with vendors regarding payment status updates.
  • **Inventory and Maintenance:**
  • Maintain up-to-date maintenance records for over 45 pianos in the western region C&A inventory pool.
  • Log work performed and technician recommendations for required maintenance.
  • Prepare requisitions for replacement supplies, parts, and materials.
  • **Marketing and Social Media:**
  • Maintain an up-to-date photo gallery of all C&A pianos from our Western markets, with a focus on pianos featured in major performance halls, live TV, film, or music videos.
  • Share these photos on our local and global social media channels.
  • **On-Call Support:**
  • Be available on a rotating schedule to respond to "piano emergencies" when the Senior Manager, Chief Concert Technician, Department Coordinator, and other team members are unavailable.
  • **Event Support:**
  • Assist with the overall needs of our west coast operations, which may include working on a limited basis to help staff special retail and institutional events.
  • **Performance Calendar:**
  • Stay informed about performances by notable artists in each market and maintain an up-to-date calendar to be shared with retail managers and sales representatives.
  • **Flexible Work Environment:**
  • Ability to work in both in-office and remote locations. (Must reside within reasonable commuting distance to the Concert & Artist Office in the Arts District of Downtown Los Angeles)

Requirements

**Qualifications:**

  • Bachelor's degree required.
  • Prior experience working in a professional business setting.
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to focus intensely and meet daily deadlines.
  • A background in music is preferred but not required.

If you are passionate about music, highly organized, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we would love to hear from you. Join our team and contribute to the success of our Concert & Artist department!

Employment Type: Full-Time
